results.title: The Queen Mother at Essendon Airport
results.brief_description:
Silent footage of the arrival on 27 February 1958 of the Queen Mother at Essendon Airport to a welcoming crowd of waving spectators, military parades and marching bands, and government officials and dignitaries. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Melbourne city parade
results.brief_description: Silent film of the Queen Mother arriving at the Melbourne Town Hall during a Moomba parade. Includes scenes of crowds lining Swanston Street; the Lord Mayor’s welcoming speech to the Queen Mother; and her departure in an open car as she waves to the crowd. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Maroondah Dam
results.brief_description:
Silent 1950s home movie footage of a family outing to the Maroondah Dam in the Upper Yarra Valley. Includes images of the landscape and boating facilities. Filmed by portrait photographer Athol Adams.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Mallacoota fishing trip
results.brief_description:
Mallacoota - There is boatloads of nostalgic charm in this short black and white 1950s film of men taking a fishing trip at Mallacoota. Photographer Athol Adams has captured a sense of fun in this footage, made more entertaining to modern eyes because of the formal clothes the fishermen are wearing. A wonderful glimpse of a different generation at play.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Henry Bolte speech at opening of relocated Dandenong Stock Market (1958)
results.brief_description:
Silent film footage of the then Premier of Victoria, Henry Bolte, presenting his speech at the opening of the Dandenong Stock Market at its new location in Cheltenham Road (1958). Includes scenes of dignitaries and spectators, and a tour of the stockyards.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.
THIS FILM IS SILENT

results.title: Dandenong
results.brief_description: A walk down memory lane in this black and white 1950s footage of the Dandenong Trades Exhibition which includes shots of white goods, furniture and TVs, Holden cars, streetscape images and a fashion parade. Also shows a blind woman working swiftly to create a bristle scrubbing brush. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Billycarts
results.brief_description: This evocative silent home movie footage shows kids playing in a billycart in the drive-way and on the street, and creates a strong nostalgia for long ago youth. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Screens and screams [the movie]
results.brief_description: In October 2002, just before opening at Federation Square, ACMI and the City of Melbourne asked the Kids Own Publishing Partnership from Ireland to run a workshop for over 300 primary school students from 8 schools in the city. Each group of kids had a different job to do - some made and filmed shadow puppets, some acted, some digitally animated, and some created an original soundtrack with artists from the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra. The result was the very first Made @ACMI student movie ‘Screens and Screams’
results.description: In October 2002, just before opening at Federation Square, ACMI and the City of Melbourne asked the Kids Own Publishing Partnership from Ireland to run a workshop for over 300 primary school students from 8 schools in the city. holdings.name: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode

results.title: Jem Cohen: early works
results.brief_description: A rich and haunting collection of early works from an artist who paints with fragments of image and sound from New York street life. Dogs, passing cars, the homeless, drugged and alienated people drift through these works, in the rhythms of their own time. Simple mysteries are uncovered through a window, in half deserted streets, and in wind blown garbage. Voices become confessions, shadows become cinematic and we are absorbed and compiled into a world of wonder, in which people inevitably leave traces - and lists.

group_works.title: This is a history of New York

results.title: This is a history of New York
results.brief_description: ‘This is a History of New York’ chronicles the seven ages of mankind from Prehistory to the Space Age. In the Age of Hunters and Gatherers, stray dogs patrol the streets while the homeless forage for food. Later in the Medieval Period, crazed street preachers pace frantically before ominous gothic architecture. The richness of Cohen’s vision is found in this haunting imagery and the perception that the thriving city of New York is really the accumulation of humanity’s failures, as well as triumphs.
